name: 余盛延
objective: 本課程精選有關教育與文化之文章，引導學生從閱讀中印證，比較各種文化和教育現象，並鼓勵學生從各種不同角度蒐集資料，俾使課堂討論呈現時代性與多元化的觀點。
schedule:
09/16 
Introduction

09/23 
Michael K's birth, childhood, disposition, and occupation; Anna K and her illness; the settings of the novel (pp. 3-16)

09/30 
The Ks'application and wait for travel permits (pp. 16-28)

10/07 
The death of Anna K in a hospital in Stellenbosch; Michael K robbed by a soldier (pp. 28-41)

10/14 
Michael K forced to labor; walking to Prince Albert; living on charity; arriving at Prince Albert; and hunting goats (pp. 41-54)

10/21
Michael K learning a lesson, burying his mother's ashes, and beginning his life as a cultivator; the unexpected visit of a deserter from the army; the Visagie grandson's assignment; Michael K running away (pp. 54-67)

10/28 
Michael K's life in the mountains and in the Jakkalsdrif labor camp (pp. 67-80)

11/04 
The function of the camp; Michael K's negotiation with a guard; Michael K forced to labor; the condition for leaving the Jakkalsdrif camp (pp. 80-93)

11/11 
Oosthuizen's wrath; Robert's influence; Michael K shouting for help; Michael K's escape from the camp and return to the Visagie farm; Michael K's life on the farm (pp. 93-106)

11/18 
Michael K's confidence, fear, and anxiety; his hiding in a cave; his freedom; the idea of the parasite; his dreams; his appetite (pp. 106-119)

11/25 
Michael K discovered by the soldiers; Captain Oosthuizen's recognition of Michael K; heavy explosions—end of Part One—Michael K's detention at the Kenilworth camp (pp. 119-132)

12/02 The medical officer's narration about Michael K; Noël and the medical officer's investigation of Michael K (pp. 132-145)

12/09 
Michael K's refusal to eat; the medical officer's undelivered letter to Michael K; Michael K's escape from the Kenilworth rehabilitation camp (pp. 145-159)

12/16 
More prisoners sent to the Kenilworth camp; the medical officer's desire to follow Michael K; the medical officer's exploration of the significance of Michael K's refusal to eat; the medical officer's comment on Michael K (pp. 159-167)

12/23 
Michael K's return to Sea Point, Cape Town; his harassment by a pimp and two prostitutes; his pursuit of an independent living as a gardener (pp. 169-184)

12/30 
Review

01/06
Final Exam

01/13 
Discussion
scorePolicy: Grading policy: attendance: 10%; quiz and presentation: 40%; final exam: 50%
